body.p: A container which typically contains a row of buttons. It is a type of box that defaults to horizontal orientation. It can be collapsed with a template.XULElem("grippy") when the toolbar is placed inside a template.XULElem("toolbox"). The toolbar should always have an template.XULAttr("id") attribute.

div.p: Gecko 2.0 geckoRelease("2.0") adds support for external toolbars. These are toolbars that are not children of a XULElem("toolbox") element. You can associate an external toolbar with a toolbox for the purpose of managing your toolbars by setting the XULProp("toolboxid") property on the toolbar.

body.p: The chromeclass-toolbar class may be used to create a toolbar where its visibility depends on the toolbar flag when opening the window with the domxref("window.open()") method.
More information is available in the XUL tutorial.

div.p: Starting in Gecko 1.9.1 geckoRelease("1.9.1"), toolbar items are moved from the XULElem("toolbarpalette") and added to the toolbar when a toolbar is first displayed. In earlier versions, a copy of each item was created and placed on the toolbar. This means that the palette now only contains items not already in the toolbar. This introduces a potential compatibility problem for extensions that depend on being able to identify all possible toolbar items by looking in the XULElem("toolbarpalette").
